title: Index of Phrack 18
historical_context: This article serves as the introduction to Phrack Issue 18, a notable hacking ezine during the late 1980s, a period marked by the rise of personal computing and early online communities.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
short_summary: This article introduces the 18th issue of Phrack, detailing the new editorial team and inviting contributions from the community. It also provides a brief index of the articles included in this issue.
summary: In the opening article of Phrack Issue 18, Crimson Death takes the helm as the new editor, following a transition from the previous editorial team due to their academic commitments. The article emphasizes the ongoing vitality of Phrack and its commitment to community contributions, inviting readers to submit their own articles for future issues. This reflects the collaborative spirit of the hacker community during this era, where knowledge sharing was paramount.
summary_details: The index lists a variety of articles that cover topics ranging from network security to Unix system issues, showcasing the diverse interests of the contributors. Each article promises to delve into technical subjects relevant to the hacking community, such as packet-switched networks and Unix security vulnerabilities. This issue serves as a snapshot of the evolving landscape of computer security and hacker culture in the late 1980s, making it a valuable resource for both historical insight and practical knowledge.
